News & Media Member Login REGISTER HERE Give Search for: Contact 2025-08-25T10:48:20-06:00 Contact Us Lakeland Hills YMCA is community-centered, bringing people of all ages and backgrounds together, to nurture potential and mobilize local communities to effect lasting and meaningful change. We look forward to helping you with your needs and answering any questions you may have. Feel free to contact us via the form below or through a membership representative at one of our local YMCAs. Contact Us Form × Contact Lakeland Hills Family Y Name * First Last Email * Who do you want to contact? * President and Chief Executive Officer, Alex Martinez Fund Development Associate, Dante Gonzalez Health & Wellness Director, Kelly Najjar Assistant Camp and Program Director, Quentin Pickering Camp & Youth Program Director, Linnea Berry Website Manager, Carmen Fritsch HR Director, Renee Dorn Chief Operating Officer, Devon Maloney Assistant Aquatics Director & Swim Lesson Coordinator, Yash Kothari Controller, Gail Shelby Fitness Director, Gerry Gessie Member Services Coordinator, Hope Hornick IT Director, Jonathan Ogintz Aquatics Manager/Lifeguard Coordinator, Sydney Jasinski Vice President Fund Development, Kaite Burke Community Engagement Manager, Kelly Horvath Early Childhood Learning Center Director, Michele Leaman Buildings and Grounds Assistant Director, Mika Newman Buildings and Grounds Director, Mike Ambrosi Membership Administrator/Day Camp Bookkeeper, Nancy Dunham Member Services Director, Reneé Welch Vice President Marketing and Membership, Rosemary Linder Day Competitive Swim Team & HR Administrator, Sarah Gulbin Senior Program Director, Shannon Bujoreanu Chief Financial Officer, Robert Marzan Early Childhood Learning Center Program Specialist & I-SWAP Manager, Cynthia Rodriguez Message * CAPTCHA URL This field is for validation purposes and should be left unchanged. Δ Close Lakeland Hills Family YMCA 100 Fanny Road Mountain Lakes, NJ Phone: 973-334-2820 membership@lhymca.com Frequently Asked Questions What are your facility hours? Our hours are: Monday – Friday 5:00 A.M – 10:30 P.M. Saturday – Sunday 7:00 A.M. – 6:00 P.M. Directions Can I access other YMCA’s with my Lakeland Hills YMCA membership? Yes. We are proud to offer our members access to YMCA facilities across the United States and Canada that participate in Nationwide Membership. This way, our members can use the Y as often as they like, making it easier to achieve their health and wellness goals. Are group exercise classes available? Yes. We have over 65 weekly classes offered from Yoga to HIT. These classes offer a great workout in a class setting, and are all included with your membership. Can I bring a friend? Yes. As a member, you are given 3 guest passes per year. You can bring a friend up to 3X for free. After that there is a fee. Guests/friends can use facility a max of 3X per year and then must become a member. Is there a trial membership to try out the Y? Yes. We have a 1-Week Trial Membership for free.  After that, we have several options that you can choose as a new member. What benefits do I get with my membership? Full Privilege Membership entitles you to use the pool, basketball gymnasium, Health and Fitness Training Center, general membership locker rooms, as well as group fitness, yoga, spinning classes, and all aqua exercise classes. Plus, three free guest passes per year and a fitness orientation. Some age restrictions apply. Long Term Locker Membership offers full privilege membership plus an assigned locker and towel service in an adult only locker room which includes steam room, sauna and TV. What are the pool hours? For Pool Hours and available swim times, please visit our schedules page where you can download swim times as well as gymnasium and group fitness class times. Do you offer financial assistance? Yes. We offer financial aid to ensure that no one is turned away from a Y program or service due to an inability to pay. Visit our Financial Assistance page for more information. STAY CURIOUS Want to know more about how you can make an impact in the community? Fill out this simple form to learn how to get involved. Last chance this week to register for fall classes, which begin Monday, September 8. Registration available 24/7 online. + +
